title.rendered: India vs New Zealand, 3rd T20I 2023: Today’s Match Preview, Fantasy Cricket Tips

content.rendered:
We have opted for a fantasy cricket team based on the recent performances, overall impact, and credit points.

Probable XIs

India: Shubman Gill, Ishan Kishan (wk), Rahul Tripathi, Suryakumar Yadav, Hardik Pandya (c), Deepak Hooda, Washington Sundar, Shivam Mavi, Kuldeep Yadav, Yuzvendra Chahal, Arshdeep Singh

New Zealand: Finn Allen, Devon Conway (wk), Mark Chapman, Daryl Mitchell, Glenn Phillips, Michael Bracewell, Mitchell Santner (c), Ish Sodhi, Jacob Duffy, Lockie Ferguson, Blair Tickner

Pitch Report

Venue: Narendra Modi Stadium, Ahmedabad

(Based on the last 3 games)

1st innings average score: 188

2nd innings average score: 179

Wickets per innings: 6

Type: Good for batting

Wins

Batting 1st: 55%

Batting 2nd: 45%

Fantasy Tips of the Day

Suryakumar Yadav’s scores in Ahmedabad read 57 and 32. Against New Zealand, he averages 52.

In 34 innings, Devon Conway has provided bonus points for 30 runs as many as 18 times.

Michael Bracewell is the only player in this contest to have an Ultimate Team percentage of 100 in the last 5 games.

In his last 5 innings, Deepak Hooda has taken 6 wickets in 9 overs. Given New Zealand’s vulnerability against spin, he has already bowled 6 overs in the series despite being the seventh bowling option.

Arshdeep Singh has gone wicketless only five times in 25 T20Is. Be it with the new or old ball, he often finds ways to be amongst wickets. After all, he strikes at 12.8.

Hardik Pandya’s numbers against New Zealand are disheartening: he averages a mere 18 with the bat and has taken only 5 wickets in 12 outings.

It has been 13 T20Is since Ishan Kishan scored a fifty. Since then, he has managed a mere 199 runs at an average of 15. To make matters worse, he averages only 17 in 6 games against New Zealand. He, however, has scored a fifty in two T20Is at the venue. Some respite!

Spinners have not had much success at the venue. 36 of 51 wickets belong to pacers.
